entry.content:
I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of scenery—air, mountains, trees, people. I thought, “This is what it is to be happy.”

  • Mary Oliver

The garden is a great place to be.
More species of flowers are on hand
than leaves upon the tree.

— “The Paper Nautilus”

  • Marianne Moore

Moonlight spills like a silver stream, Across the sleeping meadow, Where night’s perfume sways gently, And whispers of dreams, Float on the cool air of twilight.

— Vita Sackville-West

  • Vita Sackville-West

The breeze dances through the trees, Whispering secrets of the brook, The cool fragrance of the pine, Invites the wandering thought to linger on the path.

— Vita Sackville-West

  • Vita Sackville-West

entry.title: Futurist Poet - Mirroring skies on the lake

link.title: Futurist Poet - Mirroring skies on the lake

entry.content:
Mirroring skies on the lake below, Reflecting the madness of ebb and flow. In the stillness, chaos finds its muse, A fusion of worlds, where nothing’s to lose.

Gusts of wind paint stories uncaged, Ideas unleashed, art now staged. In every leaf, a tale is spun, In the wild labyrinth, wisdom won.

  • Futurist Poet
entry.summary: Mirroring skies on the lake below, Reflecting the madness of ebb and flow. In the stillness, chaos finds its muse, A fusion of worlds, where nothing’s to lose.

entry.title: Futurist Poet - Petals rain down like thoughts

link.title: Futurist Poet - Petals rain down like thoughts

entry.content:
Petals rain down like thoughts unspoken, Colors collide, a world now broken. The river runs wild, a stream of dreams, In fragmented moments, nothing’s as it seems.

A clock ticks loudly in the hush of night, Challenging the stars, seeking their light. In tangled roots, life’s laughter lies, Beauty dances in the chaos that flies.

  • Futurist Poet
entry.summary: Petals rain down like thoughts unspoken, Colors collide, a world now broken. The river runs wild, a stream of dreams, In fragmented moments, nothing’s as it seems.

entry.title: Futurist Poet - The moon hangs low an unmade

link.title: Futurist Poet - The moon hangs low an unmade

entry.content:
The moon hangs low, an unmade bed, Stars scatter thoughts, experiences shred. Time collapses in a cosmic rush, Nature’s heart beats in a fervent hush.

Every moment a canvas, every breath a stroke, From chaos arises, life’s grand joke. Windswept echoes, shadows in play, Ode to the present, dissolving away.

  • Futurist Poet
entry.summary: The moon hangs low, an unmade bed, Stars scatter thoughts, experiences shred. Time collapses in a cosmic rush, Nature’s heart beats in a fervent hush.

entry.title: Futurist Poet - The rhythm of rain taps on rooftops

link.title: Futurist Poet - The rhythm of rain taps on rooftops

entry.content:
The rhythm of rain taps on rooftops high, Little dancers falling from the sky. Each droplet a note in the symphony’s score, Nature composes forevermore.

Chaos finds form as puddles reflect, A world upside down, a perfect defect. Dada dreams in the splash of a shoe, Where art and madness finally break through.

  • Futurist Poet
entry.summary: The rhythm of rain taps on rooftops high, Little dancers falling from the sky. Each droplet a note in the symphony’s score, Nature composes forevermore.

entry.title: Futurist Poet - The sky is a fabric unfurled

link.title: Futurist Poet - The sky is a fabric unfurled

entry.content:
The sky is a fabric, unfurled blue, Threaded with dreams, drifting through Clouds that dance like wild thoughts, In a world where logic is caught, and tossed.

Silence unravels on a sunlit stream, Nature hymns in a whispered dream. A branch breaks free, a bird takes flight, In joyous rebellion against the night.

  • Futurist Poet
entry.summary: The sky is a fabric, unfurled blue, Threaded with dreams, drifting through Clouds that dance like wild thoughts, In a world where logic is caught, and tossed.

entry.title: Kurt Schwitters - A birds cry against the sky

link.title: Kurt Schwitters - A birds cry against the sky

entry.content:
A bird’s cry against the sky, Fragmented notes of freedom, Dissonance in the calm.

  • Kurt Schwitters
entry.summary: A bird’s cry against the sky, Fragmented notes of freedom, Dissonance in the calm.
